    01 - Set up project directories for climate transition risk stress test

    01-setup-project-directories.Rmd

    This vignette describes in detail, how to set up the directories that point to the input files and will contain the output files of running a climate transition risk stress test for loans, using r2dii.climate.stress.test.

    Assumptions

    In order to keep this vignette concise, we assume the following has been done:

    1. R and RStudio are installed.
    2. All required R packages are installed, specifically r2dii.climate.stress.test. Note that this may require installing additional packages. You will be prompted to install these in case any are missing.
    3. The user has obtained all relevant input files as described in the pdf manual.
    4. The user has successfully run at least the matching part of PACTA for Banks to produce the relevant project-specific raw input files.

    Project-Specific files

    The analysis builds on project-specific input files that contain information on the loan book to be analyzed and project-agnostic input files that contain auxiliary information required for the stress test. Detailed information about these files can be obtained from the pdf user manual. In case you need this document, please contact jacob@2degrees-investing.org.

    We recommend setting up one directory that contains project-specific files and a separate one that contains project-agnostic files.

    The exact names and locations of these directories can be chosen by the user, but we recommend choosing directories, from which the software can read and to which it is allowed to write data. It is also generally recommended to avoid special characters and white spaces in the name.

    The user will also have to determine an output directory. We recommend setting this up as a sub directory of the project-specific directory.

    NOTE: It is required to set up an output directory prior to running the analysis. If the software cannot find the directory that the user is pointing it to, it will fail with an error.

    A recommended structure for the project-specific data would look like this:

    • example_folder/
      • inputs/
        • raw_loanbook.csv
        • matched_loan_book.csv
      • outputs/

    A recommended structure for the project-agnostic data would look like this:

    • analysis_input_files/
      • prewrangled_financial_data_stress_test.csv
      • prices_data_2021Q1.csv
      • scenario_2020.csv
      • Scenario_AnalysisInput_2020.csv
      • prewrangled_capacity_factors_WEO_2020.csv
      • exclude-companies.csv
      • 2021-07-15_AR2020Q4_PACTA-Data (3).xlsx

    After completing the setup, follow the vignettes on how to run the analysis:

    • “Preparing the intermediate inputs for stress testing loans”
    • “Run transition risk stress test”
